{"step_by_step_thinking": "In a free gingival graft, the epithelium of the graft undergoes a process called re-epithelialization. This means that the existing epithelium of the graft will degenerate and be replaced by new epithelial cells from the recipient site. The new epithelial cells will proliferate and migrate over the graft, eventually forming a new layer of epithelium.", "answer_choice": "B. Proliferates"}
